title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 660.13 - Joint proceedings under other laws and regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 660.13 - Joint proceedings under other laws and regulations

State Regulations
(a) In the event that a petitioner for a
moratorium permit is also required to apply for a permit, license, certificate
or other approval pursuant to Part 608 of this Title, or any other Part of this

Title or any section of the Environmental Conservation Law, the local permit
agent, the central permit agent or other official before whom such application
is pending shall insofar as possible process any or all such applications in
the same proceeding as the petition for a moratorium permit and in the event of
any procedural inconsistencies between this Part and such other Part, he may, insofar as permitted by statute, follow the procedures of this Part for any and
all such applications. (b) The
commissioner may, by mutual agreement with any municipality within whose
boundary the affected tidal wetland or portion thereof is located or any other

Federal, State or local body having jurisdiction over the subject matter of the
petition for a moratorium permit or any work related to such subject matter, provide for joint processing of any such petition with any application for a
permit or other proceeding required by such municipality or body, including
provision for joint notices and hearings. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
660.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
